sample_docs: GoSafe 260 Dash Camera GoSafe 260 Dash Camera Part Number: GS260-US Description The GoSafe 260 is perfect for the individual that would rather use a rearview mirror and dashcam combination in place of their car's rearview mirror. The vivid results along with the crystal, clear capture rate of this dashcam is astounding. Clipping it on to your car's stock rearview mirror is seamlessly done with amazing results. The 2.7†screen captures a wide range with stunning quality. With an anti-glare mirror you will avoid any obtrusive lighting from the cars behind you and stay safer on the road. FIND A STORE Tweet GoSafe 260 Dash Camera Description The GoSafe 260 is perfect for the individual that would rather use a rearview mirror and dashcam combination in place of their car's rearview mirror. The vivid results along with the crystal, clear capture rate of this dashcam is astounding. Clipping it on to your car's stock rearview mirror is seamlessly done with amazing results. The 2.7†screen captures a wide range with stunning quality. With an anti-glare mirror you will avoid any obtrusive lighting from the cars behind you and stay safer on the road. The GoSafe 260 is perfect for the individual that would rather use a rearview mirror and dashcam combination in place of their car's rearview mirror. The vivid results along with the crystal, clear capture rate of this dashcam is astounding. Clipping it on to your car's stock rearview mirror is seamlessly done with amazing results. The 2.7†screen captures a wide range with stunning quality. With an anti-glare mirror you will avoid any obtrusive lighting from the cars behind you and stay safer on the road. FEATURES With a high and low temperature resistant casing, the wide viewing range of the 2.7†mirror screen is made of unique anti-glare material. Zoom in and out of any scene with the GoSafe 260 with a push of a button. Use it for taking a snapshot or while recording video. The GoSafe 260 safely replaces your car's rearview mirror so you can avoid having any bulky devices taking up space on your windshield. The GoSafe 260 comes with an automatic start-up function so you never have to worry about turning it on and off. The G-sensor capability will back-up those important files when an emergency happens, so no need to worry about losing any evidence of that unfortunate event. When you set the motion detection feature the device can be set to take a snapshot every second so you protect your car while parked. Sometimes the view is too beautiful to pass up. With the screen capture function take a snapshot and keep that memory forever. Easily watch your footage on your HD TV with the compatible HD output installed on the GoSafe 260. 1080 HD 30 fps The GoSafe 260 records in crystal clear 1080 HD video resolution at 30 frames per second. Guaranteed to create stunning footage. Video Capture Ability The GoSafe 260 1080P HD recording makes the images with higher precision, getting all the important details of an event. The best tool you can have in providing proof in case of an accident. Anti-Glare Mirror The GoSafe 260 is constructed with a unique anti-glare mirror so that you can avoid getting blind-sighted by glaring lights. 130° Recording Angle 130° recording angle will help guarantee that you capture everything that is in front of the camera with clarity and precision. Loop Recording GoSafe 260 records in loops when it powers up in 3-minute clips. When the memory card runs out of storage it will automatically loop and overwrite the old files and continue to record. Replaces your Existing Rearview Mirror The perfect dimensions of the GoSafe 260 allows you to simply clip it over your existing rearview mirror so you do not have to worry about taking up space on your windshield or dashboard. Motion Detection GoSafe 260 will detect when there is movement in front of the camera while your car is parked and begin recording until it does not detect any movement for a set amount of time. Protect your vehicle at all times. Driver Fatigue Alert A timer can be set to remind the driver to rest after a certain amount of hours on the road. Better safe than sorry. Stop & Go Alert A beep will alert you when the driver in front of you has moved. This feature will be activated when you have been stopped for at least 10 seconds. Avoid distracted driving. Built in G-Sensor The GoSafe 260 comes equipped with a built-in gravity sensor. In the event of a collision it will automatically save the file. Headlight Reminder Get alerted with a beep and light symbol when the lighting conditions change and headlights are necessary. Never forget to turn your lights on again. Wide Dynamic Range The wide range in EV values self-adjust for optimal video recording at differently lit environments. Emergency File Back-Up The built-in gravity sensor (G-sensor) will automatically back-up a file once a sudden impact is felt, or if you choose to protect a file. All important files will be write-protected in case of an accident. Lifetime Firmware Updates GoSafe 260 is eligible to receive a lifetime of free upgrades as soon as they are issued. Please check our website regularly for any new available upgrades. SPECS Specifications LCD Display 2.7″ TFT panel, 480 x 272 pixels resolution Storage Memory Class 6 or higher MicroSD or MicroSDHC card (8GB Min-32GB Max) *Please note that some cards may be incompatible- e.g., Sandisk. Video Resolution 1080FHD 1920 X 1080 720P60 1280X720 720P30 1280 X 720 WVGA 848 X 480 VGA30 640 X 480 Video Format .MOV Power Supply 5V / 1A output USB USB 2.0 Power Consumption 4.75V~5.25V /1A Operating Temperature 14°~149°F/ -10°~65°C Storage Temperature -4°~ 140°F Dimension 11″ x 4.3″x 1.9″ Weight 0.66lbs SUPPORT Manual User Guide Download Firmware File Name FW96650A.bin Product GoSafe260 Firmware Download Published Date 08/05/15 Version GS260.US.20150805(v1.16) Area United States, Canada, and Latin America Updates 1. New menu item: Power on/off Sound (Jingle) 2. Audio off/on bug. Audio recording will no longer automatically turn back on. 3. EV value bug. Set EV values will not reset after device is powered on/off. File Size 1.7 MB File Size Please do the following to upgrade the dashcam 1. Download the firmware file 2. Copy the .bin file directly onto the MicroSD card root file 3. Insert the MicroSD card into the dashcam and power it on via a 5V/1A power source, e.g. cigarette lighter or power bank 4. The upgrade will begin automatically. The LED light will flash faintly to let you know it is updating. 5. Once complete you can reformat the MicroSD card and begin using the dashcam Papago Linux FTP Site GLD Disclaimer: This product contains codes which are developed by Third-Party-Companies and which are subject to the GNU General Public License ("GPLâ€) or the GNU Lesser Public License ("LGPLâ€). The GPL Code used in this product is released without warranty and is subject to the copyright of the co. Further source codes which are subject to the GPL-licenses are available upon request. We are pleased to provide our modifications to the Linux Kernel, as well as a few new commands, and some tools to get you into the code. The codes are provided on the FTP site. REVIEWS Reviews Jim's Review Room does an excellent job pointing out the key feature of the GoSafe 260 and gives you some great installation tips… Watch Here… The dashcam is dissimulated in a windshield mirror that clips over your existing interior car mirror. The attachment system is very simple and is powered by two mobile hooks secured by an internal coil to keep the cam safe… Read More… Perhaps one of the most convenient of designs,however, has to be the one we find in the PAPAGO! GoSafe 260… Read More… Investing in the Papago GoSafe 260 is a smart investment for your vehicle. This dashcam allows you to take snap shots, zoom in and out, and it is even GPS ready… Read More… Watch the team at TVA in Canada go over the benefits of owning a dashcam… Watch Here… "It captures 1080p video with sound and comes with a built-in G-Sensor, which helps it detect hard braking and accidents." GoSafe 330 Dash Camera Full HD GOSAFE 330 Dash Camera Part Number: GS330-US Description The higher end model in our GoSafe series is the 330. This sleek dashcam will blow you away with all the technology packed into its' lightweight and streamlined design. Created in true PAPAGO! style, this device promotes safety and functionality. It loops over old footage and continuously records while plugged into the car lighter outlet or if hard-wired to your car's battery you can use the motion detection feature. Able to switch between 720p or 1080p HD 30 fps at 142° angle footage you can create images through snapshots and video at different resolutions. Individualizing your experience on the road is achievable with the GoSafe 330. FIND A STORE Tweet GOSAFE 330 Dash Camera Description The higher end model in our GoSafe series is the 330. SPECS Specifications LCD Display 2″ LCD panel Image Sensor Full HD 5.0 Mega Pixels Sensor Lens 142° wide viewing angle Lens structure N/A GPS Receiver N/A G-Sensor 3-axis G-sensor Video Format 1080p30/720p60/720p30 /.MOV Storage Memory Class 6 or higher MicroSD or MicroSDHC card (8GB Min-32GB Max) *Please note that some cards may be incompatible- e.g., Sandisk. HD Output HD Output 1.3 USB USB 2.0 LED Instruction Light Red and green indicator light Power Supply 12-24V DC input / 5V/1A output Power Consumption 4.75V~5.25V / 1A Operating Temperature 14°~149°F/ -10°~65°C Storage Temperature -4°~158°F Dimension 3.6″ x 2.4″x 1.45″ Weight 0.18 lbs SUPPORT Manual User Guide Download Firmware File Name firmware330 Product GoSafe 330 Download Download Published Date 2/11/2014 Version Ver. 4000 Area US, Canada, Latin America File Size 3.29 MB Major Update read me REVIEWS Reviews Watch Chris Voss unbox the GoSafe 330 and walk his viewers through this highly functional dashcam… Watch More… When accidents happen, our instinct is to check on our families before anything else. Noting every detail of the incident may not be on our minds. The Papago GoSafe 330 is a mini dashcam for consumer use… Read More… I used this camera for the past 2 weeks now and it was a pleasure to test it. It is compact, easy to mount and un-mount from the windshield holder… Read More… There are several dashcams on the market, the Papago GoSafe 330 happens to be one of the most feature packed dash cams with an affordable price tag… Read More… The higher end model in Papago's GoSafe series, this sleek dash cam blew me away with all the technology packed into its' lightweight and streamlined design… Read More… Bryan Burnett reviews the Papago P2 Pro and GoSafe330 Dashcams on Before You Buy episode #123. GoSafe 268 Dash Camera SONY Sensor MIrror Mount GoSafe 268 Dash Camera Part Number: GS2688G Description Record everything in your path with the GoSafe 268 dash cam's excellent 1080HD video. The mirror is made from a custom Anti Glare material, with a built-in battery in case your car loses power, PAPAGO! signature driver safety features, and a large LCD screen for viewing your videos. The Sony Sensor will ensure that you record superior nighttime footage. With the larger battery capacity the GoSafe 268 has the unique ability to record in multiple recording formats. Parking surveillance includes motion detection, monitor mode, and parking guard. With the all new parking guard feature the dash cam will record 10 second videos when the device feels a bump or is hit in anyway while parked, with or without a power supply and when the battery is fully charged. The GoSafe 268 is also compatible with the GPS antenna. FIND A STORE Tweet GoSafe 268 Dash Camera Description Record everything in your path with the GoSafe 268 dash cam's excellent 1080HD video. The mirror is made from a custom Anti Glare material, with a built-in battery in case your car loses power, PAPAGO! signature driver safety features, and a large LCD screen for viewing your videos. The Sony Sensor will ensure that you record superior nighttime footage. With the larger battery capacity the GoSafe 268 has the unique ability to record in multiple recording formats. Parking surveillance includes motion detection, monitor mode, and parking guard. With the all new parking guard feature the dash cam will record 10 second videos when the device feels a bump or is hit in anyway while parked, with or without a power supply and when the battery is fully charged. The GoSafe 268 is also compatible with the GPS antenna. Record everything in your path with the GoSafe 268 dash cam's excellent 1080HD video. The mirror is made from a custom Anti Glare material, with a built-in battery in case your car loses power, PAPAGO! signature driver safety features, and a large LCD screen for viewing your videos. The Sony Sensor will ensure that you record superior nighttime footage. With the larger battery capacity the GoSafe 268 has the unique ability to record in multiple recording formats. Parking surveillance includes motion detection, monitor mode, and parking guard. With the all new parking guard feature the dash cam will record 10 second videos when the device feels a bump or is hit in anyway while parked, with or without a power supply and when the battery is fully charged. The GoSafe 268 is also compatible with the GPS antenna. FEATURES Sony EXMOR Sensor The GoSafe 268 uses a SONY Exmor Sensor that allows for the most precise and clear picture quality that surpasses most dash cams on the market today. The combination of the high-quality glass lens and the SONY Sensor will guarantee that you get high resolution footage every single time. Exclusive! Now Supports up to a 64GB MicroSD card The GoSafe 268 uses the latest technology that allows for users to store more footage on a 64GB MicroSD card. Record footage or take pictures while parked or as a 24 hour surveillance monitor, pre-installed Stop & Go feature, and get the best video day or night with 7 levels of EV values. Innovative and cutting edge advances in our dashcams puts the PAPAGO! brand ahead of the rest. Fits Most Standard Rearview Mirrors Conveniently fits right over your existing rearview mirror by clamping securely into place. The clip will fit a rearview mirror that measures 2.2 cm thick to 7.5 cm high. The slim design will not cause your rearview mirror to become too bulky. The lens angle is easily adjusted vertically and horizontally so that you capture the most optimal view of the road. Exclusive! Parking Guard Feature The GoSafe 268 has an internal battery that can power up your device automatically to begin recording while parked if it senses any sort of impact. It will record a 10 second video and then power down to reserve the battery life. Built-In G-Sensor The GoSafe 268 comes equipped with a built-in gravity sensor. In the event of a collision it will automatically save the file. Lifetime Firmware Updates GoSafe 268 is eligible to receive a lifetime of free upgrades as soon as they are issued. Please check our website regularly for any new available upgrades. SPECS Specifications In Box GoSafe 268 Dashcam, 12V-24V power cable with detachable cigarette charger, Quick User Guide , Warranty Card, 8GB Micro SD Card with Adapter Recording Mode Automatic Recording, Monitor Mode, Motion Detection Mode, Parking Guard Driver Assistance Feature Stop Sign Recognition, Stop and Go, Fatigue Alarm, Lighting Reminder Angle 135° wide angle F2.0 lens LCD Display 2.7″ Color LCD panel Image Sensor Sony Exmor Sensor G-Sensor Yes GPS Receiver Optional. Purchased Separately. Works with PAPAGO GPS Antenna (P/N: GPSA-US) Video Resolution 1920x 1080/30FPS/ 1280×720/60FPS/ 1280×720/30FPS/ VGA 640×480 Video Format .MOV Storage Memory Class 6 or higher MicroSD or MicroSDHC card (8GB Min-64GB Max) *Please note that some cards may be incompatible- e.g., Sandisk. USB USB 2.0 LED Instruction Light Red and green indicator light Power Supply 12-24V DC input / 5V/1A output Power Consumption 4.75V~5.25V / 1A Operating Temperature 14°~149°F/ -10°~65°C Storage Temperature -4 °~158°F / -20°~70°C Dimension 11Lx4Hx2W inches Weight 300 g SUPPORT Manual User Guide Download Firmware File Name FWGS268A.bin Product GoSafe 268 Firmware Download Instructions 1. Power off the dashcam first and then eject the MicroSD Card from the dashcam. 2. Using a card reader insert Micro SD Card into your computer. 3. Drag or copy FWGS268A.bin to your SD card 4. Eject the MicroSD card from the computer. 5. Insert the MicroSD card into the dashcam and power it on. The screen will remain dark for around 1 minute and it will reboot and will ask you to set up language and local time. 6. Go to setting to verify the version: Setting ->version -> V1.02(us) Build:20160317 If it shows the correct version, then you are good to go. Published Date 4/20/2016 Version GS268:V1.02(us) Build20160317 Area US, Canada, Latin America File Size 3.5MB REVIEWS Reviews Watch Dr. Frank introduce the GoSafe 268 and all the amazing features that it has. Watch More… Along with the excellent video quality, I feel the discrete nature of having a dash cam built into a mirror is a major plus… Read More… The Papago! GoSafe 268 is a clever turn on the dash cam, since it is also a rear view mirror, which means it doesn't take up valuable dash or windshield space… Read More… "We hoped that there would be an integration of the various devices into a more streamlined "super gadget,†and have mentioned this wish to some of the dash cam folks in the past. Well, PAPAGO! has taken a step in that direction with their new GoSafe268…" Read More… "…the Papago! GoSafe 268 is easy to use, won't draw attention, and can help protect your automobile…" Read More… "If you don't want a separate device clinging to your windshield, why not consider this dashcam that clips onto your rearview mirror instead?" Read More… "The installation process for this dash cam is unbelievably easy…" Watch Video "…this form factor is by far the cleanest out there, as it attaches over your rear-view mirror already in your car." Read More… Papago, which manufactures a wide range of dash-cams, has models that range from basic cameras under US $80.00 CAD to more complex models that integrate GPS functionality as well as improved Sony Exmor sensors, intuitive features, and even high-quality 2K resolution videos. Frequently Asked Questions Dashcams Where is the dashboard camera mounted? The dashcam is typically mounted onto the vehicle's front windshield or dash board with optional purchase of dashbag. You should not set/ install this dashcam at a place that would obstruct or reduce a driver's view. Make sure your usage complies with the pertinent vehicle codes of your state, province, territory or country. How is the dashboard camera powered? Using the supplied DC power adapter, all PAPAGO! dashcams are powered through the vehicle's cigarette lighter socket. However, the design of the power supply from a cigarette charger varies by each model from car manufacturer We recommend to test or check the user manual of your car for more details. Will there be any wires hanging from my dashboard camera? All PAPAGO! dashcams comes with a 4 meters (13.25 FT) long DC power adaptor cable, which can be routed and hidden between the gaps in various places such as the vehicle's headliner and the pillar. What is the recording time of the dashboard camera? The recording time depends on the size of the memory card that is used. The GoSafe Series can support up to a 32 GB microSDHC/microSDXC Class 10 Memory Card, which allows the camera to record up to 6 hours of recording time (In Full HD 1080P resolution) before the camera loop/recycles the data. The P3 models can support up to a 32GB Class 10 Memory card (Memory Card type dependent on model) will record up to approximately 6 hours of recording time before the camera loops/recycles the data. Please refer to table below: Where is the data saved? The data will be saved into an SD or Micro SD memory card. Can you record at different resolutions? You can adjust the resolution setting within the dashcam's settings menus. Does the GPS on the dashboard camera help me navigate when driving? No, the GPS logging is similar to the time and date stamp on your dashcam and will display on your footage playback. How can I view my recorded videos? The following methods are available to view/playback the videos recorded on your dashboard camera: Dashboard Camera's Screen – Directly playback on the dashboard camera by entering the playback mode using the "MODE†button. Television – Output via HD Output to a HD enabled television Computer – Unplug your SD or Mini SD card from dashcam and plug into your computer. You can view your videos from your computer or connect your camera to a computer with the supplied USB cable. The camera will enter into Mass Storage mode, which allows the camera to act as a USB Flash Drive. Does the dashboard camera record when the vehicle is parked? The dashcam will only record when the vehicle is parked when it is plugged into an appropriate power source. If your cigarette lighter ports in your vehicle do not stay live after the vehicle has powered down, then you'll need to either hardwire the dashcam or use a power bank. How do I disable audio recording? Every device has an option to turn off audio recording. You must go through the setting options and set the voice recording option to off. Please refer to your device's user guide available under support for each model. Do I need to manually turn the dashboard camera on every time I start the vehicle? No, the dashboard camera will automatically turn on and start recording when the cigarette adaptor plug receives power. Do I need any special software to play the recorded video? If your current media player cannot play the recorded video, please download our download the latest version of quick time or download PAPAGO GoLife Software from our web site. P2 Pro-> Support-> Find GoLife Software download. Where is the GPS logging information saved? The GPS Logging information is saved in the memory card. Is the GPS Logging system live tracking? The GPS Logging system is not live tracking system. Currently it does not have the functionality to track a device. Can I connect an external hard drive to the dashboard camera? Unfortunately at this time, all PAPAGO! dashcams are designed to save video recordings onto a memory card only. How do I "save†a file when I am driving? The recorded files are automatically saved into the SD or micoSD card, depending on the model. When the memory card becomes full, the camera's loop recording function will automatically loop/recycle the oldest video recording, and creates a new one from available space. If you want to ensure that a particular file does not get erased simply back it up. Please refer to your device's user guide available under support for each model. How to make Dashcam suction cup mounts stick? Start with a clean dry surface. If the temperature of the suction cup is drastically different than that of the windshield it might cause the suction cup to lose its' grip. If you need to, a little moisture might help it to seal firmly. Find your target on the windshield, press it on, and apply firm pressure to the center of the mount. What you are doing, and want to do, is to push all of the trapped air between the mount and the windshield out from behind the mount. Try not to let the mount slide (if it slides easily you might have used too much moisture) and keep firm pressure for about fifteen seconds. Are thieves more likely to break into my car to steal the dashcam? We advise, just like you would with any valuable items, that you take your dashcam down when your vehicle is left unattended. It is helpful if you carry a cloth in your car so that you can wipe the ring off from the suction cup. Some thieves may know that such a mark is from a dashcam and may try to break into your car. How can I play the .ts file that I get from the P3 and P2 Pro on my Macintosh Computer? There are different media players you can download for free or at a low cost. VLC is the most widely used free software for MAC or Flip Player is also good to use at a low cost. How can I convert a .ts file so that I can edit with it on my Macintosh Computer? We recommend that you download Handbrake. It preserves the quality of the video 100% and is very user-friendly. Please email us at support_us@papagoinc.com if you have further questions. How do I update the firmware on my dashcam? 1) Check the version on your specific dashcam (Please refer to manual or product page). 2) Download the latest version of the firmware. 3) Unzip the file. 4) Drag and drop the file onto the SD Card. 5) Delete the old version off of the SD card 6) Plug the SD card into the dashcam. It will take a few minutes to automatically update. How do I update the Maps on my P3? 1) Download the latest version here under the Support Tab. 2) Unzip the file. 3) Delete the old Navi folder on P3 SD card and replace with new "Navi†folder 4) Plug the SD card into the dashcam. It will take a few minutes to automatically update. How do I update the Speed Camera on my P3? 1) Download the latest version here under the Support Tab. 2) Drag and drop the folder into "speedcamera†folder on SD Card 3) Delete the old "papago_spc.bin†folder on P3 SD card and replace with new "papago_spc.bin†folder 4) Plug the SD card into the dashcam. It will take a few minutes to automatically update. What do I do if the anti-virus software or browser prompts you with a warning message when downloading GoLife Run sync software for my GoWatch 770? The GoLife Run Sync software may be judged as malicious by your anti-virus software or browser and blocked from downlaoding. Please turn the anti-virus software off and download again. Make sure to turn the anti-virus software back on immediately after the download to protect your computer. Why is my dashcam giving me an error message about my SD or MicroSD card? I purchased a 8GB-32GB card and formatted it? We have found that there are some compatibility issues with some brand name MicroSD cards even after you format the card correctly. Please refrain from using these incompatible brands that cause functionality issues: Sandisk, Samsung EVO, PNY, Verbatim and most off brand cards. We recommend that you use any of the following brand cards: Transcend, ADATA, Kingston, Patriot and Silicon Power (SP). Here are the steps on how to reset the time and date? Step 1) Power on your dashcam using an appropriate power source (5v==1a, or car charger). After it's powered on you're going to push the "OK" button to make the cam stop recording. Step 2) After the cam has stopped recording push the menu button twice. Then scroll down till you see "Date/Time" selected, then push "OK" button. Step 3) After pushing "OK" it'll bring up the "Date/Time" settings screen, here you will use the arrow keys "UP" & "Down" to change it to the appropriate year, then push the "Menu" button to change the month instead also using the down/up arrow keys to find the right month, then push "Menu" again to change the day then use the down/up arrow keys to change the number of the day. Step 4) Push "OK" to keep the date/time settings you entered. Then push the "Menu" button to get out of the settings menus. Do I have to register my dashcam in order to use warranty services? There is no registration necessary. We just need you to hang on to your receipt, please. You will be asked for your receipt to use warranty services when contacting our customer service team. How do I change the MPH to KM/H on my dashcam for the GPS/Speed logging? In order to change the MPH to KM/H, please follow these steps: Step 1) Power on your dashcam using an appropriate power source (5v==1a, or car charger). After the dashcam has powered on, please push the down arrow key to bring up the settings menu. Step 2) Push the down arrow key 13 times then push the "OK" button. Step 3) Next you will see "GPS Stamp" highlighted on the screen then push the "OK" button to select this option. Step 4) After you've pushed the "OK" button you will see two options "KM" and "Mile". Push the up arrow key to highlight "KM" then push the "OK" button to make the selection. Where can get a spare part for my dashcam? If you are still within your one year warranty, you can email our customer service team at service@papagousa.com and submit the Part Request with the following information: Name, Model dashcam you own, which part you need and your shipping address then our reps will get to your request shortly. If outside of your warranty dates, the process is the same but the rep will let you know the cost and how to proceed with the transaction to complete the purchase of said part. I keep getting a "Card Full†error, isn't my dashcam supposed to loop record? In cases like these, the dashcam is often too sensitive in of the G-Sensor/Parking Guard/Bump Recording feature so most likely the dashcam is saving all the files as emergency recordings which cannot be overwritten by the loop recording function. Please format your micro SD card on your computer then set your dashcams G-Sensor/Parking guard/ feature to low sensitivity or off for testing purposes. If you are still experiencing issues after adjusting the sensitivity, please contact our customer service team at service@papagousa.com If my warranty has expired am I still able to get my dash cam repaired? Unfortunately, we do not complete any repairs at our US location and only supply replacements when warranty RMA services are requested. Where is the dashboard camera mounted?
